title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: f1 champion and driver for brackley-based mercedes , nico rosberg , retires .
police link two shops robberies that occur within 20 minutes .
brexit vote may boost home-grown christmas tree growers .

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: what a day !
you can read more on nico rosberg 's retirement from formula 1 on the bbc sport website .
remember at the beginning of the week we were only celebrating his world title for brackley-based mercedes .
there is plenty of sport over the weekend though and this is how you can follow it :
we 'll round it all up on monday - so until then , have a good evening and weekend .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : risk of frost tonight , staying dry tomorrow
text: this evening will be rather cloudy with some showers clearing eastwards .
clear spells will develop and bring the risk of a frost in places and the odd fog patch .
lows of -1 to 4c ( 30 - 39f ) .
saturday will be a little cloudy at times , but staying dry with some bright or sunny spells .
chance of an isolated shower in eastern counties , with highs of 7c ( 45f ) .
there 's more at bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: london prisoners blamed for rise in violence at hmp onley
text: prisoners moved from london to a jail near daventry have been blamed for a `` sharp rise '' in violence at the site .
hm inspectorate of prisons found standards had declined at hmp onley and declared it unsafe .
the watchdog found conditions worse than in 2012 , with staff blaming relocated london prisoners and gang issues for a near-tripling of assaults .
the national offender management service said tackling the decline in safety was the governor 's top priority .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: fa cup : brackley hoping for 'memorable occasion ' at blackpool
text: brackley town manager kevin wilkin says he hopes his players ' hard work over the past couple of weeks will pay off as they face league two blackpool tomorrow in the fa cup second round .
the non-league side have already beaten league one gillingham , with jimmy armson scoring a hat-trick in round one .

kevin wilkin says he knows it 's going to be another difficult tie at bloomfield road , but said the third round is a `` dream '' and hopes that `` friends , family and supporters can enjoy the day and hopefully we can make it a memorable occasion '' .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton Sport

documents.title: local paper round-up : charity shop break-in , fly-tipping near daventry , kettering 's apprentice star
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: any extra funding for utcs would be 'wrong ' , says teaching union
text: the national union of teachers ( nut ) says the government focus should be on colleges and sixth forms rather the university technical colleges ( utc ) , despite some utcs struggling to recruit students .
the bbc has seen a letter that shows the government is considering asking councils to write to parents explaining other schooling options including utcs .
the letter also says the utcs should be able to widen their catchment to outside their relevant local authorities .
but gordon white , from the nut in the county , says post-16 is suffering .
college and sixth forms have had funding cuts , so to increase funding to a new group of institutions for which there is no demonstrable need is wrong . ''
you can see inside silverstone utc and get more on this issue on sunday politics east , this sunday at 11:00 on bbc one .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: legislation needed to help university technical college pupil recruitment , says head
text: the principal at silverstone university technical college ( utc ) says the government needs to do more to help with student recruitment .
the colleges , which specialise in particular subjects , take students from the age of 14 at a time when teenagers do n't usually move school .
in places such as daventry , utcs are falling short of recruitment targets .
neil patterson , from silverstone utc , says the government needs to step in .
there needs to be legislation to force schools to allow utcs into them to give them proper information about their options . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: north , picamoles and hanrahan all return for saints
text: france number eight louis picamoles and wales wing george north return to the northampton saints side following their autumn internationals .
also returning for the game at arch-rivals leicester is jj hanrahan coming in at centre

documents.title: musical river walk back under way
text: yesterday we mentioned composer benjamin till , from higham ferrers , set off on a 100-mile walk that will take him from the start of the river nene in badby to its end in wisbech .
for five days he 'll listen to the river to hear its sounds and pitch to help him create the piece , titled source to the sea .
he was back out walking this morning .
he 's taken in the beautiful countryside
and the not so beautiful countryside
you can see more by clicking on his twitter feed above .
lovely place to sit and watch the world go by # neneway # justwalking

documents.title: weather : mostly dry with some sunny intervals
text: it will be dry today with variable cloud and some sunny intervals , but it will feel a little chilly with a high of 7c ( 45f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: tom wood : england now have a 'winning habit ' under eddie jones
text: northampton saints captain tom wood said `` it 's brilliant '' to be back playing for england and it was `` great to come into a winning environment '' .
the 30-year-old flanker told bbc 5 live there is `` a real feel-good factor around the camp '' that he 's noticed since his return for the autumn internationals .
england take on australia tomorrow hoping to end the year unbeaten and wood said coach eddie jones , who took over after the 2015 world cup , had `` established a winning habit '' .
wood , who was only recalled to the side by jones last month , said the australian coach was `` bringing stronger voices out and giving the players ownership of the team '' .
he added with the previous regime he had been `` expected to lead '' but not now `` because people are speaking up and getting on with their roles '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tom wood : 'if saints play well i 'll get noticed for england '
text: england coach eddie jones told tom wood in the summer that `` the door 's not closed '' on his england career , but wood said he knew he had to `` play the best rugby and get my head down at saints '' to get noticed again .
wood returned to an england side that won the six nations with a grand slam and completed a 3-0 series win in australia .
the saints captain told bbc 5 live he 's been celebrating those wins as much as the england fans , saying : `` i do n't want england to fail so i can get back in the shirt . ''
the 30-year-old said he could not `` go out and play for saints with a view to getting selected for england '' .
he said that approach would be `` selfish '' and `` you start doing things that are n't in the interests of your team , and when your team suffers you do n't play well as an individual '' .

he said the best way to get noticed is if the team plays well , `` which saints are struggling with at the moment '' , but he said the aim is still to be at the top end of the table come the end of the season .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: england v australia : dylan hartley defends dan cole scrummaging
text: england captain dylan hartley has defended team-mate dan cole after australia coach michael cheika accused the prop of scrummaging illegally .
but the saints hooker told bbc radio 5 live : `` you do n't stumble across 60-odd caps scrummaging illegally . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: hartley : i had to teach jonny may how to scrum
text: england captain and northampton hooker dylan hartley has been teaching team-mate jonny may how to scrum after the winger 's failed attempts against argentina went viral online .

after elliot daly was sent off during saturday 's 27-14 victory , may was forced to join the scrum but adopted an usual method when binding with mako vunipola , at one stage putting his head between the legs of the loosehead prop .
hartley said : `` we had a little tutorial , a one-on-one scrum session and i talked him through it because it might happen again and these are the things you need to learn . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: police link two shops robberies that occur within 20 minutes
text: police believe two robberies at co-op stores eight miles apart and within 20 minutes of each other are linked .
the first store , in finedon , was entered by three men who threatened staff with weapons at about 22:20 on wednesday .
later the same happened at the store in earls barton , with men making off with cash and cigarettes on both occasions .
northamptonshire police is appealing for witnesses , particularly anyone who may have seen a vehicle travelling at speed between the two locations .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brexit vote boost for home-grown christmas tree growers ?
text: growers of christmas trees in northamptonshire could be set to benefit from the brexit vote .
the recent fall in the value of the pound means the cost of importing trees from scandinavia has risen , making home-grown trees better value .
william miles , who grows christmas trees at portly ford farm in welford , told me the vote was `` good news '' for him , with prices of imported trees rising up to 20 % .
he said there were `` a lot of good quality trees '' grown in the uk .

although it 's too soon to tell if he will have a bumper sales year , mr miles told me he opened the business earlier - in mid-november - because people `` wanted to come and see the trees '' sooner .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: from opening the bowling to opening the stock exchange
text: at bit of change for former england and northamptonshire fast bowler devon malcolm this morning .
along with cricket charity chance to shine he opened the london stock exchange at 08:00
he opened the bowling for england and now big dev is opening the london stock exchange with the help of cts children !

documents.title: lewis hamilton : mercedes need him , so how do they manage abu dhabi fall out ?
text: the fall out at the end of the formula 1 world championship continues , with brackley-based mercedes wrestling with what to do about lewis hamilton 's disobedience at the season-ending abu dhabi grand prix .

from mercedes ' point of view , it all ended well - stevenage 's hamilton won the race , rosberg finished second to clinch the title , having navigated his way through what he described as an `` intense '' 90 minutes or so .
here the bbc 's chief f1 writer andrew benson looks at what mercedes might do with the stevenage driver now , and how it affects them going into next season .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: train fares to rise by average of 2.3 %
text: we do n't like to start your day with bad news , but if you are off to get a train then i 'm afraid fares in britain will go up by an average of 2.3 % from 2 january .
the increase in regulated fares , which includes season tickets , is capped at july 's rpi inflation rate of 1.9 % .
unregulated fares , such as off-peak leisure tickets , can go up by as much as the train companies like .
the rail delivery group , which represents train operators and network rail , said the industry was working to simplify fares and improve services .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: friday 's weather : gloomy with little in the way of sunshine
text: much milder , but unfortunately we 've lost the sunshine , so it 'll be gloomy with plenty of low cloud around and very little in the way of brightness .
temperatures up to 9c ( 48f ) .
winds are light and it should stay dry , although there may be a few spots of rain later in eastern coastal areas .
watch my full forecast here
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning .
we are back with live updates for northamptonshire until 18:00 .
we have news about university technical colleges in the county .

plus , we 'll be building up to huge weekend of sport , including fa cup football , derby day in the rugby , plus four saints players in action for england against australia , including captain dylan hartley .
you may have noticed that because it 's now december he 's shaved off his moustache - his top lip must be feeling the chill .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us today
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
any breaking news will appear here through the evening and overnight .
tomorrow , amongst other things , we 'll be building up to non-league brackley town 's fa cup second-round tie at league two blackpool .
we 'll see you at 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : freezing tonight with fog
text: a dry and largely cloudy night with some clear spells across the east region .
where skies clear , it could freeze with temperatures dropping close to 0c ( 32f ) and patchy fog and frost is likely .
it 'll be a chilly start to friday with some frost and fog to clear .
it 'll then be a generally cloudy day with perhaps a little brightness and sunshine at times .
some parts could also see a bit of light and showery rain .
top temperature 9c ( 48f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: wily mp plays first article 50 card - but why ?
text: speaking of peter bone , the conservative wellingborough mp introduced a private member 's bill aimed at cutting through the constitutional imbroglio over the triggering of the process to leave the eu yesterday .
his withdrawal from the european union ( article 50 ) bill would require the government to start the formal process by 31 march 2017 .

the small snag is that it does n't have a prayer of getting a second reading debate - so why is the wily mr bone , a veteran of the private member 's bill process , as well as a key anti-eu agitator on the tory backbenches , bothering ?
mr bone is playing a game of commons `` chicken '' - but how does that work ?
you can read my latest blog on how this might fall through a hidden legislative trap-door .
author: Mark D'Arcy
Parliamentary Correspondent

documents.title: will the uk pay for single market access ? no , says peter bone
text: the brexit secretary david davis has told mps the government would consider paying money to the eu after britain has left the organisation , in return for securing access to the single market .
until now , ministers have been reluctant to admit that a deal on the single market might involve continuing to make contributions to eu coffers .
the conservative mp for wellingborough , peter bone , says he ca n't see a situation where the uk will have to pay .
i do n't think it 's going to happen .
in that very hypothetical case people will be exceptionally upset about it .
but it 's just not going to happen . ''
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: musical river walk takes in the bridges and underpasses of the nene
text: more now from benjamin till 's walk along the nene .
he is strolling the whole length of the river , looking for inspiration for a new piece of music .
but it 's not just pretty riverbanks he 's encountering
'nuff said # justwalking
tunnel under the grand union canal # neneway # stillwalking

documents.title: final edition of the northants herald & post out today
text: today sees the last edition of the northants herald & post .
the free paper is being closed by its owner trinity mirror , which bought it as part of the local world group takeover last year .
trinity mirror said it would `` retain a presence in a different way '' in northamptonshire .
the herald & post was found in 1975 by businessman and journalist tony boullemier .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police say drink drivers think 'a crash wo n't happen to me '
text: pc dave lee , from northamptonshire police , told me that he has seen the consequence of drink-driving , and that a few years ago he had to do the `` dreaded door knock '' after someone was killed drink-driving just before christmas .
despite the increased awareness around drink-driving , pc lee said there were persistent offenders and that `` people think 'it 'll never happen to me ' , but these things do '' .
last year the police carried out 1,725 tests during december , with 79 people arrested .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: message about drink-driving is getting through , say police
text: northamptonshire police 's annual christmas drink-drive campaign began this morning , with motorists in one part of northampton being pulled over at random and breathalysed .
last year the number of arrests in december for drink or drug-related offences was 79 , while the year before it was 76 .
the police told me that with the number of motorists on the road increasing , but arrests staying the same , it 's a sign that their message is getting through .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: local paper round-up : christmas safety , smoking area removed , weedon lifesaver
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy , especially further west
text: a mainly dry but rather cloudy afternoon , especially in the west , perhaps with the odd spot of light rain over the hills .
the best of any brighter weather will generally be further east .
today 's high will be 6c ( 43f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: composer walking the river nene sees some 'quirky ' sights
text: composer benjamin till , from higham ferrers , has this morning set off on a 100-mile walk that will take him from the start of the river nene in badby , to its end in wisbech .
inspired by the river , he 'll create a piece of music titled source to the sea .
so far he 's seen some interesting sights
why do people put cans of drinks on sticks in hedges in weedon bec ?
# justwalking
newnham - quite quirky # justwalking

documents.title: rising cost of rents part of homelessness problem , says kettering council
text: the head of housing at kettering borough council says there has been a `` very sudden increase in private sector rents '' in the borough .
john conway said landlords were focusing on those on `` reasonable jobs '' rather than those `` on benefits or part of the low-wage economy '' .
figures analysed by the charity shelter show kettering is the worst hotspot for homelessness in the east midlands , followed by wellingborough and northampton .

mr conway said northamptonshire was suffering because of the `` dysfunctional housing market '' in london and the south east , with the county seeing an increase in people from those areas looking for housing and in turn driving up house prices and rents here .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hundreds of people homeless in northamptonshire
text: kettering is the worst affected town in the east midlands for homelessness , according to analysis of official figures by the housing charity shelter .
it says one in 444 people are without a home in kettering borough , with a total of 225 people currently homeless .
in the east midlands , this was followed by wellingborough ( one in 484 ) and northampton ( one in 523 ) .
the government disputes the figures , but shelter says they could be even higher as they do n't include people staying with friends .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hartley , wood , and lawes all start for england
text: northampton saints forwards dylan hartley , tom wood , and courtney lawes ( all start for england this saturday in the last autumn international .
australia are the opponents at twickenham as england look to complete a clean-sweep of the autumn series , and win four in a row against the wallabies .
saints flanker teimana harrison is on the bench , and hartley will once again captain the side .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: tales from the riverbank : river nene inspires music project
text: the river nene has become the inspiration for a classical musical project .
benjamin till , from higham ferrers , has this morning set off on a 100-mile walk that will take him from the start of the river nene in badby , to its end in wisbech .
for the next five days he 'll listen to the river to hear its tunes and pitch to help him create the piece , titled source to the sea .

he says he 's `` slightly terrified '' by the task in hand , and thinks one of the biggest issues could be how to pronounce nene , as it 's said differently depending whether you come from northamptonshire or cambridgeshire .
he also was n't `` expecting frost '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: alice barnes joins sister hannah in british cycling 's 'podium programme '
text: british cycling has confirmed the riders who are on the great britain cycling team podium programme , its elite squad , and they include 21-year-old alice barnes (
the towcester cyclist joins her sister hannah , 23 .
the barnes sisters are in the women 's road cycling squad alongside world champion lizzie deignan , olympic gold medalist dani king , and pro-rider nikki brammeier .
programmes director andy harrison said the inclusion of alice barnes had `` bolstered '' the team and the squad would `` lead us into the next olympic cycle '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : dog helps fire crews in the east midlands
text: this dog has 16 pairs of shoes that 's more than me !
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: in sunset over northamptonshire
text: we 've been sent some lovely of the sunset over the county yesterday .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: problems on northamptonshire 's roads
text: there have been crashes on the a45 westbound and on the a14 eastbound this morning .
plus there is also disruption on the a43 and the a4500 , meaning the roads coming into northampton are quite busy .
every route from north and east of the county coming into northampton currently gridlocked @ twitterid
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: british grand prix at silverstone confirmed in formula 1 calendar
text: the formula 1 season has only just finished but the sport 's governing body , the fia , has published the schedule for next year - and the british grand prix at silverstone will be on 16 july 2017 .
germany has been dropped from the calendar , and the brazilian grand prix is also in doubt as it is listed as provisional .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: festive drink-drive campaign launched today
text: northamptonshire 's christmas drink-drive campaign is being launched today .
police will be carrying out breath tests around the county during the festive season .
they 're starting with roadside tests at an undisclosed location this morning .
i 'm going out to see them and we 'll bring you more on this throughout the day .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: rosberg 's formula 1 world title 'well deserved ' , says hamilton
text: lewis hamilton has taken to twitter to congratulate his team-mate nico rosberg after the german secured the formula 1 world championship on sunday .
he also posted this of the two from the beginning of their racing career

documents.title: weather : frosty , cloudy but dry
text: early patchy frost , mist and fog will clear to leave a mostly cloudy but dry day .
the best of any brighter weather will be further north-east .
lows of 3c ( 37f ) .
tonight , it will be mainly cloudy but largely dry , occasional clear spells may allow the odd patch of mist or fog to form and perhaps a slight ground frost in places .
highs of 7c ( 44f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: problems at birmingham new street affecting trains through northamptonshire
text: this morning there have been `` signalling issues '' at birmingham new street station .
the signals have been fixed but there are still delays and cancellations affecting london midland services through long buckby and northampton in both directions .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: welcome back
text: hello again .
it is 1 december , so crack open the advert calendars !
between now and 18:00 we 'll be bringing you the latest news , weather , sport and travel .

and there 's some earlier morning reading for you - as the bbc has learned a company under investigation over missing public money intended for the sixfields stadium redevelopment received almost £ 1m in vat repayments .
you can read the full investigation here .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football loan firm 's £ 900k tax repayment
text: football loan firm 's £ 900k tax repayment
author: Matt Precey
BBC Look East

documents.title: regular updates throughout the day
text: that 's it for today for our regular updates of news , sport , travel and weather .
any big stories that break overnight will appear here , but the regular updates will start again at 08:00 .
scroll down to see what 's been going on in northamptonshire today .
have a good evening .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: police warn of 'emergency ' caller in northampton
text: people in northampton are being warned about a woman who is knocking on doors around the town and pleading for money .
the woman appears to be upset and asks for cash to help with a family emergency .
police say they believe her story is false and they want any incidents to be reported immediately .
they have also issued advice about unexpected callers :

documents.title: weather : dry night with the risk of frost
text: staying dry with clear spells this evening , but some areas of cloud at times .
not such a cold night as last night but still the risk of a frost .
temperatures down to 0c ( 32f ) .
some areas of mist and fog , with some pockets of frost to start the day tomorrow .
becoming brighter with sunny spells .
highs of 5c ( 41f ) .
you can find your local forecast at bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: rugby : 'the boys are hurting just as much as the crowd '
text: saints ' lock michael paterson says his team-mates are as miserable as the fans about the recent run of form .
northampton lost to newcastle on friday and had kieran brookes sent off .
michael paterson 's hoping for a long-overdue win in this weekend 's east midlands derby against leicester .
`` welford road is a tough place to play , '' he said , `` but it tests you and probably brings out the best in the boys '' .
it does n't make our weekends any easier when we lose .
our family and friends have to put up with the moods that they should n't have to put up with . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: sport : local bowlers unbeaten so far in world championships
text: desborough 's rebecca wigfield and northampton-born jamie-lea winch ( are currently in new zealand competing in the women 's fours at the world bowls championships .
with their team-mates wendy king and ellen faulkner , they are currently unbeaten in the first two days of competition after six games .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: cash machine blown up during rushden theft at petrol station
text: a cash machine at a petrol station in rushden has been damaged in an explosion by thieves who then stole money .
a gas canister was used in the operation , which took place in the early hours of monday morning .
police have only just released the details .
a white estate car left the scene shortly after the explosion .
this was clearly an extremely dangerous thing to do , so close to a petrol forecourt , and it is fortunate that no further explosion or damage was caused . ''
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton general hospital apologises for handover delays
text: managers at northampton 's main acute hospital say they 're sorry that many patients who arrive by ambulance have to wait for some time before they can be admitted .
figures obtained by the bbc show that paramedics spent a total of 5,000 hours at northampton general in the last financial year waiting to drop off their patients .
that 's an increase of 2,000 hours on the previous year .
kettering general has seen a similar rise in delays .
deborah needham , the chief operating officer at northampton general , said : `` unfortunately we experience periods of extreme pressure when we simply have more patients than available beds .
`` this impacts on our ability to accommodate ambulance arrivals as promptly as we should . ''
she said changes have been introduced that have reduced the average wait time to less than the national standard of 15 minutes .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: gritters on standby across northamptonshire for tonight
text: highways officials have confirmed on social media that main roads in the county will be gritted again tonight .
northants highways
nnhighways
planned action on p1a & b routes from 18.00hrs .
rst 's forecast to be -3.7 winter service duty manager to monitor .
planned action on p1a & b routes from 18.00hrs .
rst 's forecast to be -3.7 winter service duty manager to monitor .
thank you , we rely on you doing a good job .
thanks and have a happy krimble .

BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: watch : ambulances used 'like gp service '
text: this video gives you an idea what it is like to be an east midlands paramedic on shift
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northants mp 's brexit bill presented to commons
text: wellingborough mp peter bone has presented a bill that requires the government to trigger article 50 by 31 march 2017 .
in a brief procedure , mr bone informed the speaker that the measure would have its second reading on 16 december .
unless an mp objects on that date , the bill will continue to its committee stage .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: in the papers
text: the chronicle and echo reports that a number of shopkeepers in northampton town centre are being taken to court for not paying a levy imposed to fund a business improvement district .
the evening telegraph asks whether travellers should be banned from a car park in corby .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: watch : tour an emas ambulancewarning : third party content , may contain ads
text: this is pretty cool - take a 360 degree look around an emas ambulance with community paramedic tracy cunningham
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy later and cold
text: weather watcher jackie has captured this image of a dusting of frost across her garden in northampton , where she recorded a temperature of 2c ( 36f ) .
skies will be turning cloudier later , although some brightness will remain .
there 'll be light winds , but it will still feel cold with a maximum temperature of 5c ( 41f ) .
get the full forecast from the bbc weather site .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: man sentenced to 16 years for abusing children
text: a northampton man has been jailed for a total of 16 years for a. campaign of sexual abuse against children , including the rape of a child under the age of 13 .
jason scott james , 46 , who lived in duston , pleaded guilty to four counts of rape and was also convicted of three more child rapes .
he also pleaded guilty to one allegation of causing or inciting a child to engage in sexual activity .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: wellingborough mp to introduce article 50 bill
text: wellingborough mp and prominent leave campaigner peter bone is introducing a parliamentary bill later today to trigger brexit by the end of march 2017 .
the `` withdrawal from the european union ( article 50 ) '' bill will receive its first reading in the commons after prime minister 's questions .
the second reading will take place next month , unless any mp raises an objection in the house on that day .
the advantage of this bill is parliament will be implementing the will of the british people and the courts will not be able to intervene to stop it . ''
the measure would require the government to inform the european council of the uk 's intention to leave the union by 31 march 2017 .
mr bone said : `` i find it hard to believe that any colleague would object to it .
`` if they did , they would go against the wishes of the british people and have to explain how they think their view is superior to that of the people . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: a day in the life of the ambulance service
text: east midlands today 's health correspondent rob sissons is spending today with east midlands ambulance service to witness first-hand the pressure staff are under .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hamilton one of the best ever - rosberg
text: hamilton one of the best ever - rosberg
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: private bin collection company can 'survive ' better than council service , says authority leader
text: the tory leader of northampton borough council , jonathan nunn , told me he does not have `` any ideological objection '' to bringing bin collection back in-house , but contracting the service to a private company has `` come out on top '' .
mr nunn said a private firm can `` survive '' things such as a sudden increase in costs or investment in equipment better than a council-run service could .
the current contract , held by amey , runs out in 2018 and the labour opposition won a vote last night to reconsider bringing bin collections back under the authority 's control .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: big increases in handover delays at northants hospitals
text: the bbc 's discovered there 's been a big increase in delays in admitting patients to hospitals when they arrive by ambulance .
shortages of staff or space in the hospital often results in paramedics having to wait with their patient until the hospital can accept them .
about 5,000 hours of ambulance time were lost as a result of delays at northampton general hospital in the last financial year , compared to 3,000 hours during the previous 12 months .
delays at kettering general resulted in the loss of 3,700 hours of ambulance time in the financial year 2015-16 , up from 2,500 .
it can be very frustrating when people are having to wait for ambulances to respond to their 999 call when we have patients who are waiting to be handed over at hospital . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: rethink ordered on bin collections in northampton
text: the ruling conservative group on northampton borough council has been told to look again at the way bin collections will be organised from 2018 onwards .
the tories wanted to offer the contract to private firms , but the opposition labour group said that an in-house option should be considered .
labour forced a special scrutiny meeting to be held on the issue .
a conservative councillor did n't turn up , so the opposition won the vote .
the plan to offer the contract will now have to be reconsidered , but the end result could still be the same .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: campaign for dementia care nurses in northampton
text: a campaign 's been launched for the introduction of specialist dementia care nurses in northampton .

so-called `` admiral nurses '' , who give expert practical , clinical and emotional support to families living with dementia , have been working in other parts of the country for up to 25 years , but there are none in the northampton area .
andy roberts , whose mother was diagnosed with dementia , has organised a special event at northampton 's guildhall to discuss how a local scheme could be set up .
he looked after his mother for several years before she went into a care home .
`` it was a worrying time , quite a lonely time , '' he said .
`` it just identified the need for someone to take the pressure off when stress levels are already very high . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: turn wasteland into football stadium for poppies , says kettering councillor
text: a kettering councillor is calling for wasteland at weekley glebe to be turned into playing fields and a community stadium , which could be used by kettering town football club .
independent councillor michael brown is to submit a motion to the council next month .
he says the council-owned scrubland , known as frenches field , is the ideal site for a community sports stadium that could be used by the poppies .
the club has been playing its home games in burton latimer for a number of years after being evicted from its rockingham road ground in kettering .
the derelict stadium 's future remains uncertain , with attempts being made by supporters to give it the status of a community asset so football can continue there .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: handover times improve in derby
text: while the total time for handovers has risen sharply in the east midlands , locally things are looking a bit better .
both the royal derby hospital and burton 's queen hospital saw an 8 % drop in total handover times from 2013/14 to 2015/16 .
however , the chesterfield royal hospital saw a 26 % increase in the same period .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : ambulance boss on handover times
text: richard henderson , acting chief executive of emas , has been speaking to east midlands today about the advantages of cutting hospital handover times
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: number of ambulance call-outs rises by a fifth
text: emas has seen a 20 % rise in the number of life-threatening calls over the past two years , according to the figures obtained by bbc .
despite some improvements in the region , handover delays - that 's hospitals keeping ambulance patients waiting to be accepted at a & e - are generally a worsening problem .
author: Elise Chamberlain
East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: over nine minutes to respond to life-threatening calls
text: east midlands ambulance service ( emas ) was one of just two trusts in england that showed average times topping eight minutes for the second highest priority calls , including strokes and fits .
this chart shows emas 's average response times to :
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ambulances too slow to 999 calls
text: across the bbc today an investigation has revealed the extent of pressures on england 's ambulance service , including here in the east midlands .
many of the issues are down to long delays in handing over patients at hospitals .
we 'll be bringing you updates on how our ambulances perform here in nottinghamshire and the wider region throughout the day .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wednesday 's weather : very cold , with lots of sunshine
text: it 'll be a similar day to yesterday - dry , bright and sunny with temperatures struggling to reach 2c to 5c ( 36f to 41f ) .

tonight wo n't be as cold as the past couple of nights , with many places staying above freezing , although there may be one or two spots where the temperature is lower , leading to a little patchy frost .

documents.title: welcome back to our live coverage for northampton
text: good morning .
we start with the news that ambulance crews are being given longer to get to some life-threatening calls , as part of a national project to tackle poor response times .
a bbc investigation shows our service is still failing to get to many urgent calls on time .
the chief of east midlands ambulance service , which covers northamptonshire , says some people can expect `` more of a conversation '' about their condition before an ambulance is despatched .
more details to follow .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

it 's going to be another chilly one tonight and a frosty start tomorrow , so do n't forget to send us your either by email or via twitter .
see you tomorrow from 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : cold overnight and tomorrow
text: temperatures are dropping sharply overnight tonight with the risk of freezing fog patches developing and a widespread frost , with lows of -5c ( 23f ) .
a frosty start to tomorrow with freezing fog patches slow to clear .
staying cold but bright , with long spells of sunshine and highs of just 5c ( 41f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .

BBC Look East weather

documents.title: disruption on northampton to london rail line expected into rush hour
text: london midland says an incident that has blocked the northampton to london euston line is between hemel hempstead and apsley , and cancellations and delays will likely continue until 18:00 .
the company says it has ordered buses to take passengers from northampton to wellingborough , where they will be able to get an east midlands train to st pancras .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northampton to london rail line blocked
text: bad news if you are getting a train from northampton down to london
more when we get it .

author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: nico rosberg says debate over lewis hamilton 's tactics is 'pointless '
text: formula 1 world champion nico rosberg says the debate around mercedes team-mate lewis hamilton 's tactics in the season-ending abu dhabi grand prix is `` pointless '' .
stevenage 's hamilton ignored team orders and drove deliberately slowly in an attempt to back rosberg into rivals .
mercedes could take action against hamilton , but rosberg said he `` understood '' the briton 's tactics .
`` it 's done , it 's a thing of the past and it 's fine , '' said the german , 31 .
speaking on bbc radio 5 live , rosberg refused to be drawn on the subject , saying he `` respected '' hamilton because they were `` really good friends back in the day '' .
you suspect though this is n't the last we 've heard of this - despite the season being over .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : cold , but sunny
text: after a very cold and frosty start it will be a largely sunny day .
despite the sunshine it 's going to remain cold though , with a high of just 4c ( 39f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

text: police have escorted two 50m wind turbine blades through northamptonshire .
they started near junction 20 of the m1 and made their way to a site near santa pod raceway .
now they start again - to up and drop off the third blade .
this was the sight of one of the blades on the a45 earlier

text: northamptonshire police is currently escorting three 50m ( 164ft ) wind turbine blades through the county to a site near santa pod raceway , on the bedfordshire border .
if you 've been following it on twitter you would have seen they started near leicestershire
they then went onto the m1 , exiting at junction 15

documents.title: northampton swimming club says town should get its own 50m pool
text: there are calls for a new 50m swimming pool in northampton .

jacqui marshall , from northampton swimming club , says despite producing swimmers like paralympic gold medalist ellie robinson ( their members have to travel to corby to compete in an international-sized pool .
ms marshall said those she coaches have to start swimming at the corby pool at 05:00 and travel from as far away as brackley - a two hour round trip .
the next nearest indoor 50m pool is either coventry or luton .
we 've called the borough council for comment .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: yes it 's cold , but how cold ?
text: temperatures in the east of england plummeted last night with the mercury falling below zero for many of us across the region .
look east weather man dan holley has been crunching the numbers .
santon downham in suffolk was the coldest at -6.4c ( 20f ) while cromer was a positively balmy 2.2c ( 36f ) .
east anglia : everywhere except cromer went subzero last night - santon downham fell to -6.4c , it 's coldest temperature since january 2015
this seems to indicate it was colder in bedford in january of this year ?
well spotted , took me a little while but eventually found the error in my coding !
this should read a little better ha

documents.title: olympic boost to swimming , says northamptonshire sport
text: jackie browne , from northamptonshire sport , says although nationally there has been a drop in the numbers of people swimming , the county 's pools have seen a boost following the recent olympic and paralympic games .
in the east midlands there has been a 27 % drop in the number of people swimming in the last 10 years , including in places like the mounts baths in northampton (

however , jackie browne said the success at rio earlier this year may reverse that trend , as since then they have seen an increase the number of people wanting to use the county 's pools , whether for recreational swimming , lessons , or other sports such as synchronised swimming or water polo .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: corby bucking the trend as swimming grows in popularity
text: the demand for swimming and diving lessons in corby is so great at its new pool there are now nearly 800 people on the waiting list and extra swimming lessons are expected to be introduced .
it bucks the trend as figures today show nationally there has been a drop in the number of people swimming at least once a week .
the corby east midlands international pool , which opened a few years ago , currently offers 1,200 swimming lessons a week .
but that does n't seem to be enough to cope with the numbers of children and adults wanting to learn to swim .
the waiting list for lessons is now approaching 800 , up from 500 a year and half ago .
the borough council , which runs the pool , is now hoping to add additional lessons on saturday and sunday mornings .
overall , a further 64 swimming lesson classes could be created , offering an additional 512 spaces .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: lewis hamilton : mercedes will wait to decide on any action for ignoring team orders
text: brackley-based mercedes says there is `` no rush '' to decide whether to take further action against lewis hamilton following the season-ending abu dhabi grand prix .
stevenage 's hamilton drove deliberately slowly in an attempt to back team-mate nico rosberg into rivals .
the german finished second to win his first title .
`` there 's no time pressure , '' a spokesman said .
`` we 'll let the whole thing settle and then figure out the way forward .
`` for now , the focus is on savouring and celebrating the world championships . ''
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: a wintry northamptonshire
text: let 's start today with the very cold scenes around northamptonshire this morning
you can send your suitably wintry to us by becoming a bbc weather watcher .

documents.title: weather : cold , dry and sunny
text: after a very frosty start it will be a dry and sunny day , but it will feel cold throughout with a high of 6c ( 43f ) .
here 's my full forecast

BBC Look East weather

documents.title: water supply problems in rushden
text: hundreds of homes in rushden are having problems with their water supply this morning .
anglian water says a burst main means low water pressure or no water at all .
the company hopes to have the supply back to normal by midday .
there 's a road closure on college street while repairs are made .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: welcome back to live updates
text: good morning .
it 's certainly a frosty and cold start across northamptonshire , but we are still here bringing you all the news , weather , sport and travel for the county that you need .
if you want to get in touch then please email me , tweet us or head to facebook .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
if you want to relive nico rosberg 's formula 1 title win for brackley-based mercedes , head to the bbc sport website .
and we 'll see you tomorrow from 08:00 for all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county .

documents.title: overnight weather : brrrrrrr widespread frost
text: do n't forget to allow a bit of extra time if you 're driving anywhere early tomorrow morning and your vehicle 's not under cover - we 're in for the coldest night of the autumn so far , with a widespread , locally hard frost and a few mist patches .
temperatures will fall to -6c ( 21f ) in prone rural spots , in light , variable winds .
tuesday will start cold and frosty , but it 'll stay dry with long spells of sunshine .
top temperature : 7c ( 46f ) .
get a more detailed forecast where you live , from bbc weather .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: rugby : saints ' brookes facing possible five week ban
text: northampton saints ' prop kieran brookes will face an rfu discplinary hearing tomorrow .
brookes was sent off during the saints defeat on friday for charging into a ruck and making contact with the head of newcastle 's scott lawson .
if found guilty , he could face a five week suspension .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: kettering to offer some free parking over christmas
text: kettering borough council says it will offer free parking in the town centre on the next three saturdays in the run-up to christmas .
it will also offer free parking for the next three thursdays after 15:00 .
last week the council drew criticism for its parking charges , which are to be reviewed next year .
kettering 's council-run car parks cost £ 1 an hour or £ 6 for more than three hours , with parking free on sunday .
in comparison northampton offers two hours free on weekdays and free parking on weekends , while wellingborough offers free parking in council car parks .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local paper round-up : new police superintendent , mums in need giveaway and entertainment at market
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dog walker attacked by masked gang in northampton
text: a woman was subjected to a violent attack by a masked gang while walking her dog in northampton .
the victim was attacked sometime between 20:15 and 20:45 on friday in park walk , behind south oval , kings heath .
between six and eight offenders , all male and wearing balaclavas and hoodies , grabbed the victim before pushing her to the floor and kicking and punching her .
they then ran off .
police have appealed for witness or information about the attack .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bride-to-be fulfils octopus ambition
text: bride-to-be fulfils octopus ambition

documents.title: weather : fine and dry with increasing amounts of sunshine
text: there will be increasing amounts of sunshine across northamptonshire during the day .
despite the sunshine and light winds it will feel cold , with a high of 7c ( 45f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: the morning after for world champion nico rosberg
text: yesterday nico rosberg secured the formula 1 world championship for brackley-based mercedes .
looks like he had quite a party to celebrate
however , no sign of team-mate lewis hamilton .
fête bien ton titre , a armes egales , tu ne l'aurait jamais remporte .
i see lewis has gone to cry about losing and not celebrating with nico : p
where is lewis
parabens campeão .
genio ! ! !
felicitaciones y dale un pañuelo al `` lento '' de tu compañero ! ! !
jojojo ! !
nico is simply the best ! ! ! !
campeon
i think daniel ricciardo soul of the company ) ) )
insegnate a tutti come spaccarsi ammerda !

0 o big congrat from asia
como les gusta la fiesta ! ! !

is that toto wolff at the bottom ?
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: engineering not about 'oily rags ' , says university
text: meanwhile , the university of northampton says it wants to encourage more young women to become engineers .
only 14 % of students studying science and engineering nationally are female .
john sinclair , dean of the faculty of arts , science , and technology at the university , says it is trying to `` shift '' attitudes .
mr sinclair said young women seem interested in computing and that helps push the figures of females studying science , technology , engineering and maths ( stem ) up .
however , he said the numbers studying engineering specifically have been staying constant over the last few years .
he said engineering was no longer about `` oily rags '' , but that changing the perception of engineering `` will take time '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: engineering firm hoping to inspire children to 'build the next great things '
text: a corby company says it wants to convince more young people to become engineers .
rs components has built a mobile technology centre which it 'll be taking around schools nationally .

james howarth from the company said there is `` a shortage of engineers '' and that it wants to get school children interested in engineering because `` we need people to run our factories , to go into robotics and to build the next great things '' .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: without sikh food donations 'i would n't be alive ' , says homeless man
text: one of the people who uses the homeless langar service in northampton says it is `` massively important '' and he `` plans his day around it '' .
regarding the food provided by the town 's sikh community , steve said : `` without it i do n't think i would be alive today . ''
last night was the service 's second anniversary and the volunteers have fed more than 100 people in that time .
steve said he `` makes sure '' he goes to the base on abington street for the food on sundays , which `` set him up for the week '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: olly murs to play northampton 's county ground
text: as part of his 2017 tour singer olly murs will be performing at the home of northants cricket , the county ground in northampton .
the former x factor runner-up says he is `` thrilled '' to be playing at the ground , which has previously hosted madness , elton john and tom jones .
northamptonshire county cricket club chief executive ray payne said the show was part of the club 's offering `` beyond just cricket '' .
the show will be on 14 july 2017 and tickets go on sale on friday .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: homeless service 'inundated with donations '
text: amarjit atwal , one of the organisers of the homeless langar service in northampton , says initially it aimed to help out for just a `` few weeks '' .
but yesterday , the handing out of food and clothes to homeless people by the town 's sikh community passed the two year milestone .
mr atwal says it has been `` inundated with donations '' of food and clothing and that `` the volunteers love to get involved '' .
he added : `` we 've been through two winters now but we 're still going strong - it 's a great achievement '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'hundreds ' of homeless helped by sikh community
text: people in northampton 's sikh community who have been providing hot meals , drinks and warm clothing for homeless people in the town say they 're proud of what they 've achieved .
volunteers have been helping out rough sleepers from a base on abington street every sunday for the past two years .
it 's believed they 've assisted hundreds of people during that time .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: unusual sea creatures found on coast
text: there was something rather fishy going on at brancaster in north norfolk at the weekend .
beach walkers could be forgiven for thinking they 'd walked into the set of a deep-sea movie .
the giant sea creatures were for a marine-themed stag and hen party , for sara underwood and long-time partner andy york ( immediately below ) .
the couple , from brigstock in northamptonshire , are getting married in three weeks ' time .
sara , 50 , had always wanted to be an octopus and says the nautical stag-do was a perfect ice-breaker for friends and family .
like most friends of the bride-to-be , beth jones chose her outfit carefully coming as seaweed , with husband steve dressed as a cleaner fish .
fifty guests joined the seaside spectacle , with some coming from as far away as cornwall .
sara 's parents , tony and sue underwood ( as seahorse and parrot fish ) have a holiday home in brancaster , and the area has wonderful childhood memories for sara .
what could be a better way to brighten up a cold november day ?
after paddles and photographs on the sea shore , the party - including jellyfish , mermaids , octopus and an 8ft cod - headed off for a supper of fish and chips .
`` the sun shone , the sea was a silvery colour dog owners frantically trying to stop their pets from grabbing tentacles of the octopus i woke up this morning thinking did this happen ? ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lewis hamilton says car failures cost him world championship
text: lewis hamilton says car failures were the only reason he lost his world title to mercedes team-mate nico rosberg .
the stevenage driver had three engine failures over the season , which impacted on his points total , while rosberg had none .
hamilton won sunday 's season-ending race in abu dhabi but the german was second - sealing the championship .
`` i did everything i could , particularly towards the end .
nico had a clean year without any real issues and that 's why we sit in this position , '' he said .
`` but he did a fantastic job , so big congratulations to him . ''

you can read more of my analysis of the formula 1 season on the bbc sport website , including how hamilton denied using `` dirty tricks '' to prevent rosberg winning the title and how hamilton 's actions in defeat were as big a story as rosberg 's triumph .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer in Abu Dhabi

documents.title: is rosberg a worthy formula 1 world champion ?
text: formula 1 reporter tom clarkson and formula 1 analyst allan mcnish discuss whether nico rosberg is a worthy world champion .
the brackley-based mercedes driver clinched his first title at the abu dhabi grand prix , beating stevenage 's lewis hamilton by just five points in the overall standings .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: nico rosberg says world championship win 'unreal '
text: after nico rosberg secured the formula 1 world championship for brackley-based mercedes , he spoke to tom clarkson .
he told him it was `` unreal '' and that mostly he felt `` relief ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: nico rosberg secures f1 title despite lewis hamilton winning in abu dhabi
text: nico rosberg won his first formula 1 world title despite lewis hamilton disobeying orders from the brackley-based mercedes team not to back his team-mate into rivals .
stevenage 's hamilton won the abu dhabi gp driving slowly in an attempt to bring other drivers into the battle , knowing he needed rosberg to finish below third .
hamilton was repeatedly told to speed up , but told the team : `` let us race . ''
rosberg came under pressure from sebastian vettel , but held off the ferrari driver to finish second and secure the world championship ahead of hamilton by five points .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer in Abu Dhabi

documents.title: weather : dry , cold and sunny
text: after a cloudy start there will be increasing amounts of sunshine , but it will feel cold with a high of 8c ( 46f ) .
here 's my full forecast

documents.title: welcome to live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning .
we are back bringing you all the news for northamptonshire that you need to know between now and 18:00 .
we 'll be looking at the efforts to recruit people into engineering in the county and the help homeless people receive on a sunday night in northampton .
plus there will be plenty of reaction to nico rosberg 's formula 1 world championship for brackley-based mercedes .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live
